business.headline: US markets gain sharply on hopes of tariff talks: Will Dalal Street continue rally?If Wall Street wraps up today's session on a strong note, it could deliver a big dose of confidence to investors worldwide, especially in Asian markets.

US markets rally as Dow Jones jumps 1,100 points, Nasdaq, S&P surge 3%The surge in US stocks came as investors looked for any indication that the US might be open to easing some of its tougher tariffs through negotiations.

Opting for new tax regime? Know about this Rs 7,000 post office savings benefitAs per a government notification issued back in 2011, interest from post office savings accounts is exempt under Section 10(15) of the Income Tax Act.

Sensex, Nifty end higher on global recovery and RBI rate cut expectationsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 1,089.18 points to close at 74,227.08, while the NSE Nifty5o gained 374.25 points to end at 22,535.85.

RBI MPC to announce decision on April 9: Will there be a rate cut?Since the last MPC meeting, held in February 2025, a lot of things have changed, both positive and negative. While inflation has come down, and growth has started to pick up, there are fresh worries about the global economy.

'Economic nuclear war': Billionaire business titans slam Trump's tariff gambitDonald Trump's tariff agenda is fracturing elite support, with top businessmen — from Bill Ackman to Jamie Dimon — warning it risks recession, inflation, and global instability.

Hotmail co-founder Sabeer Bhatia on Indian engineers: '99% start giving gyaan'Sabeer Bhatia pointed out that in India, people respect those who talk business, not those who write code or build software. This mindset, he says, is stopping India from becoming a hub of innovation.

Sensex up 1,600 points: Which stocks are driving the rally on Dalal Street?Markets saw a huge rebound from yesterday's crash as they staged a robust recovery as no stocks on the Sensex of Nifty50 traded in red in the afternoon session.

Trump's tariff war may backfire, says JPMorgan CEO, urges stronger India tiesJPMorgan CEO, Jamie Dimon, explained that higher costs of imported goods would affect consumers, while increased demand for local products could also drive prices up.

Unified Pension Scheme: Centre studying global models to manage UPS pool corpusThe government aims to create proper rules for investing the extra contribution made by it in a separate pension fund called the pool corpus under the newly launched Unified Pension Scheme (UPS).

Japan's Nikkei leads Asia's recovery as hopes rise for softer tariff approachA 5.6% rebound in Japan's Nikkei far outpaced other regional markets, with Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Trade Representative Jamieson Greer tasked with leading trade negotiations with Tokyo.

Explained: Why Titan share price jumped 7% after hitting 52-week lowThe recovery in Titan share price came just a day after the stock touched its 52-week low of Rs 2,947.55. In the morning session, Titan shares climbed to a high of Rs 3,222, providing some relief to investors after a tough few months.

Sensex, Nifty in green: Why is stock market rising today? 3 things to knowSensex, Nifty today: Tracking global markets that showed signs of recovery, Sensex and Nifty surged more than 1.5% in early trade, shaking off fears that had weighed heavily just a day earlier, with early buying seen across most sectors.
Sensex, Nifty gain as global markets recover from Trump's tariff shockThe S&P BSE Sensex surged 1,217.78 points to 74,355.68, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 380.50 points to 22,542.10 as of 9:35 am.
Global markets show signs of recovery. Will Sensex and Nifty gain today?A slight improvement in global markets, especially in the US and Asia, has brought some hope after the recent sell-off.

Stocks to watch on April 8: M&M, BEL, Adani Ports, Tata Motors, TitanInvestors are likely to keep a close eye on Tuesday's market, looking for signs of a rebound. Asian markets opened higher, offering some relief after a choppy session in the US.

Wall Street's fear gauge spikes, stocks sink as Trump stands firm on tariffsWall Street equities have been hammered since US President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs, announced on April 2, on all imports into the US and much higher levies on some major trading partners.

How market reacted briefly to Donald Trump tariff pause rumourA misinterpreted comment about Trump pausing tariffs briefly sent markets soaring before crashing. Social media spread the false claim, prompting a quick White House denial that ended the short-lived rally.

Wall Street slides again on tariff fears; will Sensex, Nifty follow suit?Wall Street remained weak on Monday, with all three major indexes falling for a third straight session. The drop came after US President Donald Trump announced a new round of heavy tariffs on imports, which led to retaliation from major trade partners, including China.

S&P 500 rebounds after early trade fall in volatile US market sessionThe S&P 500 has dropped 20% from its peak closing level reached in February. If it finishes at this level or lower, it would officially mark the start of a bear market from February onward.

LPG cylinder prices hiked by Rs 50 for both subsidised, non-subsidised consumersThe government has hiked LPG prices to recover past losses, pushing up household cooking costs at a time of rising economic uncertainty and global trade tensions.

After Trump, EU wants India to remove tariffs on car imports: ReportThe European Union is pressing India to eliminate steep import tariffs on automobiles under a long-delayed trade deal , with India signalling a willingness to offer more attractive terms.

Sensex closes 2,200 points lower as Dalal Street logs worst session in 10 monthsStock market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex ended 2226.79 points lower at 73,137.90, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 742.85 points to trade at settle at 22,161.60. Most of the broader market indices also crashed during the extremely volatile trading session.

Excise duty on petrol, diesel increased by Rs 2; no impact on consumersThe move comes at a time when global crude oil prices are actually on a downward trend, driven by fears of a global trade war sparked by the US administration's reciprocal tariffs.

Apple flies iphones from India and China to dodge Trump's tariffs: ReportApple is closely studying how different tariff rules in various countries could impact its supply chain. The US remains one of Apple's key markets, and the company is trying to avoid passing on higher costs to customers.

$10 billion wiped out: India's richest 4 take a hit in stock market crashThe country's top four billionaires, Mukesh Ambani, Gautam Adani, Savitri Jindal & family, and Shiv Nadar, together lost over $10 billion as markets around the world fell sharply.

What is 'Black Monday' stock market crash? Know why it's making headlines againOn Friday, April 4, 2025, the US stock market had its worst day since the Covid-19 crash. More than $5 trillion was erased in a matter of hours as stocks plummeted, and volatility soared.

Stock market crash: What should investors do as Trump tariffs batter portfolios?Dalal Street is bleeding as global turmoil deepens amid Trump's tariff shock. Read on to find out what investors should do now amid the chaos and confusion.

India's worst stock market crashes: From Covid-19 to Trump tariffsOn Monday, April 7, the Indian stock market faced one of its biggest falls since June 2024. The Sensex fell nearly 4,000 points, while the Nifty 50 slipped below 21,750, dragging down investor confidence.

Stock market crash: Which sectors have been hit hardest today?All sectors ended deep in the red, triggering sharp wealth erosion for investors. Some bore steeper losses than others. Here's a breakdown of the hardest-hit sectors in today's session.

Explained: Why Tata Motors share price fell 10% todayTata Motors share price: Tata Motors' stock has seen a steady decline over the past few months. It has fallen by 17.12% in the last five trading days alone. In the past six months, the stock is down by 39.42%. Over the last one year, it has lost 44.50% of its value.

Sensex plunges 3,000 points: 5 reasons behind stock market crashShare market crash: Dalal Street is facing its worst trading session in a year, as Donald Trump's tariff shock has sparked a global rout and reignited fears of a looming recession.

Rs 19 lakh crore wealth wiped out on Dalal Street; no stock trades in greenThe sharp fall in the stock market followed a global selloff triggered by rising trade tensions and growing fears of a recession in the United States. Markets around the world have come under pressure, and Indian stocks were no exception.

Global stock markets crash as Donald Trump's tariff tsunami wipes trillionsDonald Trump's tariff salvo has triggered a global market meltdown, leaving investors rattled and economies on edge. Here's how markets from Wall Street to Asia are reacting to the unfolding chaos.

Sensex falls to 10-month low, Rs 19 lakh crore wiped out amid Trump tariff shockShare market crash: With today's stock market plunge, the Sensex and Nifty have fallen to their lowest levels in approximately 10 months, and analysts suggest that they could fall further due to massive volatility in global markets.

Stocks to watch on April 7: Tata Motors, ITC, L&T, Nykaa, IndusInd BankShares of firms such as Tata Motors, ITC, L&T, Nykaa, IndusInd Bank, Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders, TVS, Bajaj Housing Finance, YES Bank etc. will be in focus today due to important developments.

Asian markets plunge as Trump tariffs spark global sell-off; Nikkei dives nearly 8%Asian markets tumbled sharply following Wall Street's crash, triggered by Trump's tariff escalation and Beijing's retaliation. Japan's Nikkei led the losses, diving nearly 8%, as recession fears gripped investors.

Asian markets suffer huge plunge as Trump's tariffs make Wall Street bleedFutures markets moved swiftly to price in almost five-quarter-point cuts in US rates this year, pulling Treasury yields down sharply and hampering the dollar.

'Black Monday': US expert warns Trump tariffs could trigger worst crash since 1987Jim Cramer warned that markets might face a bloodbath similar to 1987 - when the Dow Jones suffered its biggest single-day crash to date. He claimed that if the US President didn't 'reach out' to nations which have not imposed retaliatory tariffs and reward them for their compliance, the situation could worsen.

Piyush Goyal announces helpline for startups days after 'dukandari' jibe at themDays after questioning the innovation of Indian startups overtly focussing on food delivery and betting and fantasy sports apps, Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal announced a helpline for startups if they wanted to make suggestions or file complaints.

entertainment.headline: Producer Salim Akhtar, who launched Rani Mukerji, diesProducer Salim Akhtar died on April 8. He is survived by his wife, Shama Akhtar, and their son, Samad Akhtar.

Hulu outage hits thousands after Handmaid's Tale premiereHulu experienced a major outage on April 8, affecting over 13,000 users. Login and streaming issues were reported after The Handmaid's Tale premiere. Hulu advised basic troubleshooting and device restarts.
Kunal Kamra 'would rather check into mental hospital' than be on Bigg BossComedian Kunal Kamra shared a post on social media and revealed that he has been approached for the new season of Bigg Boss.

Odela 2 trailer: Tamannaah Bhatia as Shiva Shakti is ready to take on evilTamannaah Bhatia-starrer Odela 2 trailer released today, April 8. The supernatural thriller by Sampath Nandi will release in theatres on April 17.

Malaika Arora stuns with her dance moves on Roop Suhana on Hip Hop India 2. WatchActor Malaika Arora impressed fans with her moves again in a new video. The actor is judging the show with Remo D'Souza.

Actor Tillotama Shome gets emotional over director's remark and proving him wrongActor Tillotama Shome recently recalled a director's remarks on money and how she proved him wrong. The actor, in an interview, got emotional while recalling the incident.

Lenin title glimpse: Akhil Akkineni breaks away from lover boy imageThe title glimpse of Akhil Akkineni's upcoming film Lenin was unveiled on his birthday by father and actor Nagarjuna. The one-minute teaser hints at a powerful comeback of the actor.

Music icons Madonna, Elton John bury old hatchet: A healing momentMusic titans Madonna and Elton John have ended their decades-long feud after the former artiste paid a visit to John post-performance. Madonna shared a post about the same on her social media handle.
Logout trailer: Babil Khan's thriller is a wake-up call on phone addictionBabil Khan starring Logout trailer released on April 8. The film will premiere on Zee5 on April 18.

Alia Bhatt's latest ad has fans calling her Madhuri Dixit's 'unofficial daughter'Bollywood star Alia Bhatt's latest ad is trending on social media, where she is channelling a 90s vibe. The actor's avatar in the commercial is being praised by fans, with many comparing her with a younger Madhuri Dixit.
SRK, Suhana Khan's King delayed due to script setback: ReportShah Rukh Khan and Suhana Khan's King is reportedly delayed amid script changes. The film is expected to release in theatres in 2026.

Krrish 4: Hrithik Roshan in triple role, reuniting with Preity Zinta | ExclusiveActor Hrithik Roshan will most likely be seen in a triple role in the next Krrish film. The movie will also see him sharing screen space with close friend Preity Zinta once again.

Chef Vikas Khanna backs actor Gaurav Khanna as he gets trolled for copying a dishActor Gaurav Khanna faced criticism over the originality of his dessert on Celebrity MasterChef. However, chef Vikas Khanna has now come out in support of the actor and extended his best wishes to all the contestants of the season.
Govinda's wife Sunita Ahuja gets angry over divorce rumours: Dogs will barkGovinda's wife Sunita Ahuja reacted to divorce rumours. Angry with the rumours, Ahuja said, 'dogs will bark.'

Now You See Me: How the magical heist franchise was ahead of its timeThe Now You See Me franchise introduced audiences to a world where magic and heists collided, offering a fresh twist on the crime genre. Before the third film hits the theatres, let us delve into why and what made this franchise stand out.

Allu Arjun turns 43: Icon star greets fans outside his homeTelugu superstar Allu Arjun's birthday turned into a grand fan celebration on Tuesday. A sea of fans gathered outside his residence in Hyderabad, and the actor was seen greeting the crowd and waving to them warmly.

TAPS: How a YouTube film is broadening the understanding of queer lives A short film on YouTube, titled 'TAPS', has travelled across the world through various film festivals. Backed by Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal, it became one of the most seamlessly designed films on gay relationships in India.

Filmmaker Alfonso Cuaron in talks to direct new James Bond movieAcclaimed director Alfonso Cuaron is reportedly in talks to direct the next James Bond movie. While an official announcement is yet to be made, the filmmaker hinted about the project during a recent event.

5 reasons why Allu Arjun and Atlee's big-budget actioner could be a game-changerThe announcement video of Allu Arjun's next with Atlee was more than a birthday special teaser - it offered a glimpse into one of Indian cinema's most ambitious projects. Built with global technicians and futuristic storytelling tools, the mega-budget actioner aims to set a new benchmark for mainstream Indian entertainment.

general news.headline: Raghuram Rajan points out the silver lining for India in US-China trade warIn an interview with India Today TV, Raghuram Rajan urged India to move swiftly but wisely on trade talks with the United States and reform its own tariff structure.

104% tariffs imposed on China, confirms White House, effective from April 9The US has escalated its trade confrontation with China with the imposition of 104 per cent tariffs on Chinese imports. The tariffs will come into effect from April 9, the White House confirmed.

Mahua Moitra claims fish shops shut, traders threatened at Delhi market; BJP reactsTMC's Mahua Moitra claimed that BJP leaders were threatening fish traders for running their business next to a temple in Delhi's Chittaranjan Park, a Bengali-dominated area. The BJP accused Moitra of trying to disturb communal harmony and police said the matter was under enquiry.

Priyansh-powered PBKS hand 4th straight loss to CSK despite Dhoni cameoIPL 2025, PBKS vs CSK: Priyansh Arya was the star of the show as Punjab Kings defeated Chennai Super Kings and handed them a fourth loss on the trot on Tuesday, April 8. MS Dhoni's cameo wasn't enough in the end as Punjab got their first win at home.
Gold biscuit to wedding saree, bizarre things Indians left behind in Uber cabsMumbai has dethroned Delhi as the most forgetful city in India, according to Uber's 9th Annual Lost & Found Index.

How Supreme Court cleared 10 Bills using extraordinary powersThe Supreme Court on Tuesday used its extraordinary powers to clear 10 Bills. It criticised Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi's "pocket veto" of the Bills, and resorted to Article 142, which was rarely used before, for "complete justice". The use of Article 142 had earlier been criticised as "judicial overreach".

Kalyan Banerjee's tirade against 'rude female MP' as Trinamool feud goes publicA bitter feud between Trinamool lawmakers came into public after the BJP's IT Cell in charge Amit Malviya shared a video and screenshots of a heated exchange between them.
Kunal Kamra 'would rather check into mental hospital' than be on Bigg BossComedian Kunal Kamra shared a post on social media and revealed that he has been approached for the new season of Bigg Boss.

Thai restaurant offers discount if you're 'skinny'. So disrespectful, says InternetChiang Mai Breakfast World in Chiang Mai has introduced a challenge where diners can get up to a 20 per cent discount on their bill if they can squeeze through a series of narrow vertical metal bars.

5 IAS aspirants injured after car rams pedestrians in Delhi, students lead protestSix people, including five IAS aspirants, were injured after a speeding Hyundai i10 car rammed pedestrians in Delhi's Old Rajinder Nagar. While five those injured are expected to be discharged soon, one may require more treatment.

No, Mamata doesn't need to go to jail for Bengal teachers. Here's a way outOver 25,000 teachers lost their jobs in West Bengal after a Supreme Court ruling on a tainted recruitment process. The list includes scores of candidates who made it on merit and their lives have been upended. CM Mamata Banerjee said she was ready to go to jail for them. Mamata doesn't need to go to jail, but do something simple to save thousands of families from financial ruin.

Waqf Act comes into force days after Parliament passage, President's nodThe Waqf Amendment Act, 2025, officially comes into effect today, marking a significant update to the legal framework governing waqf properties in India.

Video: UP man lies on track, lets train pass over him for Instagram reel; arrestedIn Unnao, Uttar Pradesh, a youth named Ranjeet Chaurasia risked his life by lying on a railway track to shoot a reel, as a train passed over him. He added a song from Shah Rukh Khan's film Baadshah to the video and shared it on Instagram, seeking fame.

Tech, tradition, political timing: Modi's Pamban Bridge symbolism that few missedWhether the new bridge becomes a lasting symbol of integration or remains a contested marker of central messaging will depend on public memory and political tides

Who is Priyansh Arya? 24-year-old PBKS batter hits record IPL hundredIPL 2025, PBKS vs CSK: Priyansh Arya was at his very best when he scored a 39-ball hundred for the Punjab Kings in their match against the Chennai Super Kings on Tuesday in Mullanpur.
Blankets distribution in 40 degrees Celsius: Bihar BJP minister's gesture goes viralA BJP minister distributed blankets in Bihar while the temperature soared to 40 degrees Celsius.
Producer Salim Akhtar, who launched Rani Mukerji, diesProducer Salim Akhtar died on April 8. He is survived by his wife, Shama Akhtar, and their son, Samad Akhtar.

US markets rally as Dow Jones jumps 1,100 points, Nasdaq, S&P surge 3%The surge in US stocks came as investors looked for any indication that the US might be open to easing some of its tougher tariffs through negotiations.

Pooran, Marsh fireworks hurt KKR in Eden thriller as LSG climb to top fourIPL 2025, KKR vs LSG: Kolkata Knight Riders lost a high-scoring thriller to Lucknow Super Giants by 4 runs. Nicholas Pooran and Mitchell Marsh's fireworks helped the visiting team post a winning total of 238 at Eden Gardens on Tuesday, April 8.

Picasso vs Nazis: The rebel artist who redefined war, art and freedomPablo Picasso, who died on April 8, 1973, left behind not just paintings, but explosive stories of exile, rebellion, humour and genius. Behind his fame was a man of contradictions—brilliant, obsessive, wildly witty, and at times cruel.

Influencer Apoorva Mukhija's powerful post, her first after Latent row, police casesYouTuber Apoorva Mukhija broke silence and spoke about receiving death and rape threats after India's Got Latent controversy. The actor shared her first post after wiping her social media clean following the backlash.

Canada raises minimum wages, Indians, in particular, will benefitAmid the high cost of living in Canada, the increase in the minimum wage in the private sector might bring some relief to those in temporary jobs, especially Indian students. Since April 1, the minimum wage has been raised from 17.30 Canadian dollars to 17.75 per hour.
Cars torched, stones thrown as Waqf protest turns violent in BengalA large crowd had gathered to demonstrate against the Waqf Act when a clash broke out between the protesters and police.

In Telangana, a battle over my tree vs your treeThe Telangana government has sparked a massive row with its attempt to clear 400-acres of forest land next to the University of Hyderabad and auction it. Team Revanth Reddy is now engaged in a tree-for-tree battle with KCR's BRS, blaming it for felling 12 lakh trees.

sports.headline: Markram gives insights into plan to counter Varun Chakravarthy and Sunil NarineLucknow Super Giants (LSG) batter Aiden Markram gave insights into their plan to counter Sunil Narine and Varun Chakravarthy's threat in the game against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR). Markram scored 47 (28) and added 99 runs for the first wicket with Mitchell Marsh as LSG beat KKR by four runs.

Samson's captaincy comeback had calming influence on squad: Shane BondRajasthan Royals (RR) assistant and fast bowling coach Shane Bond feels Sanju Samson's comeback as captain has had a calming influence on the entire team. Samson finally returned as captain and wicketkeeper for Rajasthan in the previous game after playing first three matches as an Impact Substitute due to injury.

Washington Sundar in awe of GT bowlers: Restricting teams to below 180 is amazingIPL 2025, GT vs RR: In the press conference before the match against Rajasthan Royals, Washington Sundar heaped praise on the Gujarat Titans' bowlers for their wholehearted efforts.

How Shreyas Iyer chat helped Priyansh Arya score 39-ball hundred vs CSKPriyansh Arya revealed the chat he had with Shreyas Iyer which helped him to score his maiden IPL hundred against CSK on Tuesday, April 8. Priyansh's knock helped PBKS secure a big win at home against Chennai.

MS Dhoni fan bursts into tears as CSK loses fourth on the trot vs Punjab KingsA MS Dhoni fan was seen crying in the stands after Chennai Super Kings (CSK) lost their fourth consecutive match in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) against Punjab Kings in Chandigarh.

Neeraj Chopra to begin season with Doha Diamond League on May 16Neeraj Chopra is all set to take part in the Doha Diamond League, which is set to take place on May 16. Chopra triumphed at the Qatar Sports Club in 2023, setting a world-leading throw of 88.67m.

After Tilak Varma, Devon Conway retires out in tense run-chaseIPL 2025, PBKS vs CSK: Devon Conway retired out on 69 runs, but the Chennai Super Kings slumped to an 18-run defeat to the Punjab Kings at the Maharaja Yadavindra Singh International Cricket Stadium in Mullanpur.

Priyansh-powered PBKS hand 4th straight loss to CSK despite Dhoni cameoIPL 2025, PBKS vs CSK: Priyansh Arya was the star of the show as Punjab Kings defeated Chennai Super Kings and handed them a fourth loss on the trot on Tuesday, April 8. MS Dhoni's cameo wasn't enough in the end as Punjab got their first win at home.

Sundar annoyed with question in GT vs RR presser: When did I say that?IPL 2025: Washington Sundar was visibly not happy with a question from a journalist in the press conference before Gujarat Titans' match against Rajasthan Royals on Wednesday in Ahmedabad.

Rishabh Pant explains decision to not bat, says right-left call worked for LSGIPL 2025, LSG vs KKR: Rishabh Pant did not bat during the entire 20 overs, choosing instead to hold himself back. LSG posted 238 on the board and successfully defended it for 2 points in Kolkata.

Our curator has enough publicity: KKR captain Rahane dodges pitch questionKKR captain Ajinkya Rahane dodged questions about the pitch in Kolkata after their 4-run loss to LSG on Tuesday, April 8. The Eden Gardens curator came under the spotlight after his comments early in the season.

After Tilak Varma, Devon Conway retires out in tense run-chaseIPL 2025, PBKS vs CSK: Devon Conway retired out on 69 runs, but the Chennai Super Kings slumped to an 18-run defeat to the Punjab Kings at the Maharaja Yadavindra Singh International Cricket Stadium in Mullanpur.

Priyansh-powered PBKS hand 4th straight loss to CSK despite Dhoni cameoIPL 2025, PBKS vs CSK: Priyansh Arya was the star of the show as Punjab Kings defeated Chennai Super Kings and handed them a fourth loss on the trot on Tuesday, April 8. MS Dhoni's cameo wasn't enough in the end as Punjab got their first win at home.

Sundar annoyed with question in GT vs RR presser: When did I say that?IPL 2025: Washington Sundar was visibly not happy with a question from a journalist in the press conference before Gujarat Titans' match against Rajasthan Royals on Wednesday in Ahmedabad.

Rishabh Pant explains decision to not bat, says right-left call worked for LSGIPL 2025, LSG vs KKR: Rishabh Pant did not bat during the entire 20 overs, choosing instead to hold himself back. LSG posted 238 on the board and successfully defended it for 2 points in Kolkata.

Our curator has enough publicity: KKR captain Rahane dodges pitch questionKKR captain Ajinkya Rahane dodged questions about the pitch in Kolkata after their 4-run loss to LSG on Tuesday, April 8. The Eden Gardens curator came under the spotlight after his comments early in the season.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
